contentBlocks.title: General Requirements
items: A heating or cooling system must be capable of being deactivated when the building or part of a building served by that system is not occupied
When serving more than one heating or cooling zone or area with different heating or cooling needs, must thermostatically control the temperature of each zone or area
Must not control the temperature by mixing actively heated air and actively cooled air
Must limit reheating to not more than 7.5 K rise in temperature for fixed supply air rate

Must limit reheating to not more than 7.5 K rise in temperature at the nominal supply air rate but increased or decreased at the same rate that the supply air rate is respectively decreased or increased for variable supply air rate

Which provides the required mechanical ventilation, other than in climate zone 1 or where dehumidification control is needed, must have an outdoor air economy cycle if the total air flow rate of any airside component of an air-conditioning system is greater than or equal to the flow rates in Table J6D3
Which contains more than one water heater, chiller or coil, must be capable of stopping the flow of water to those not operating
With an airflow of more than 1000 L/s, must have a variable speed fan when its supply air quantity is capable of being varied
When serving a sole-occupancy unit in a Class 3 building, must not operate when any external door of the sole-occupancy unit that opens to a balcony or the like, is open for more than one minute
Must have the ability to use direct signals from the control components responsible for the delivery of comfort conditions in the building to regulate the operation of central plant
Must have a control dead band of not less than 2Â°C, except where a smaller range is required for specialised applications
Must be provided with balancing dampers and balancing valves, as required to meet the needs of the system at its maximum operating condition
Must ensure that each independently operating space of more than 1 000 m2 and every separate floor of the building has provision to terminate airflow independently
Must have automatic variable temperature operation of heated water and chilled water circuits
When deactivated, must close any motorised outdoor air or return air damper that is not otherwise being actively controlled

contentBlocks.title: Multiple Systems Control
items: When two or more heating or cooling systems serve the same space they must use control sequences that prevent the systems from operating in opposing heating and cooling modes

contentBlocks.title: Time Switches Requirements
items: A time switch must be provided to control a heating or cooling system of more than 2 kWr
A time switch must be provided to control a heater of more than 1 kW used for heating
The time switch must be capable of switching electric power on and off at variable pre-programmed times and on variable pre-programmed days

contentBlocks.title: Time Switch Exemptions
items: A heating or cooling system that serves only one sole-occupancy unit in a Class 2, 3 or 9c building
A heating or cooling system that serves a Class 4 part of a building
A conditioned space where heating or cooling is needed for 24 hour continuous use

contentBlocks.title: Boiler Requirements
items: A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 90% at 100% of rated output
A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 85% at 30% of rated output
A boiler with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum efficiency of 80% at 10% of rated output

contentBlocks.title: Chiller Requirements
items: A chiller with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 3.0 at 100% of rated output
A chiller with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 2.5 at 50% of rated output
A chiller with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 2.0 at 25% of rated output

contentBlocks.title: Heat Pump Requirements
items: A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 3.5 at 100% of rated output
A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 3.0 at 50% of rated output
A heat pump with a rated output of more than 400 kW must have a minimum coefficient of performance (COP) of 2.5 at 25% of rated output

contentBlocks.title: Exemptions
items: A heating or cooling system that serves only one sole-occupancy unit in a Class 2, 3 or 9c building
A heating or cooling system that serves a Class 4 part of a building
A heating or cooling system that serves a building or part of a building that is not required to be air-conditioned
A heating or cooling system that serves a building or part of a building that is required to be air-conditioned but is not required to be mechanically ventilated
A heating or cooling system that serves a building or part of a building that is required to be air-conditioned and mechanically ventilated but is not required to have an outdoor air economy cycle
